opportunities.title: RockEDU Summer Science Research Program
opportunities.description: Insightful elective courses, guest lectures, and workshops. Insight into the SSRP every summer.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 7-week summer science research program at Rockefeller University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Rockefeller University welcomes 32 students into the SSRP every summer. Over the course of seven weeks, students and their mentors will work in four research groups. The 2026 session will run from June 22 through August 6.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in assigned laboratory groups
  • Attend elective courses and guest lectures
  • Participate in workshops and mentorship sessions

Requirements:

  • Must be aged 16+ at the start of the program
  • Strong interest in biomedical research
  • Commitment to the full 7-week duration

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from leading scientists
  • Insightful elective courses and workshops
  • Exposure to a world-class research environment
opportunities.applicationProcess: Applications are submitted online. Students must complete an application form and request a reference from a mentor/teacher. Detailed essays are typically required.

opportunities.title: Research Science Institute (RSI)
opportunities.description: Mentorship by accomplished professors and experienced researchers. Highly selective program at MIT.
opportunities.shortDescription: A highly selective 6-week research program for juniors at MIT.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This highly selective program brings together 100 STEM-minded juniors from the U.S. and abroad to the MIT campus. The first week is dedicated to intensive STEM classes, and you’ll spend the rest of the time working on individual projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete intensive STEM coursework in the first week
  • Conduct individual research projects under mentorship
  • Read current literature in your field
  • Prepare and deliver a final written and oral report

Requirements:

  • Current High School Juniors only
  • Exceptional academic record in math and science
  • Demonstrated potential for leadership in science

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship by accomplished professors
  • Access to MIT campus resources
  • Networking with top global STEM students
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via the Center for Excellence in Education (CEE) portal. Requires high school transcript, standardized test scores (PSAT/SAT/ACT), and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Applied Research Innovations in Science and Engineering (ARISE)
opportunities.description: Diverse networking opportunities and social events. Work in one of NYU's 80+ research labs.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 10-week free summer research program for NYC students at NYU.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This free summer program will help you develop foundational research skills in STEM. You’ll be working in one of NYU’s 80+ research labs and receive a $1,000 stipend.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in a faculty lab for 10 weeks
  • Attend weekly workshops and events
  • Present research findings at a colloquium

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors and seniors
  • Must be a current NYC resident
  • Strong interest in STEM disciplines

What We Offer:

  • $1,000 Stipend
  • Foundational research skills training
  • Diverse networking opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays and transcript. Selected candidates are invited for group interviews and lab tours.

opportunities.title: Simons Summer Research Program
opportunities.description: 15+ areas of knowledge to choose from. Hands-on research in science, engineering, and math.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 6-week hands-on research program at Stony Brook University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Stony Brook University welcomes students interested in hands-on research in science, engineering, and math. You can choose to stay on campus (housing fees apply) or commute.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in daily research activities
  • Participate in weekly faculty research talks
  • Produce a written research abstract and poster

Requirements:

  • Currently in 11th grade
  • Must be aged 16+ by the start of the program
  • United States citizenship or permanent residency

What We Offer:

  • Choice of 15+ research areas
  • Experience at a major research university
  • Opportunity to live on campus (optional)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Students must be nominated by their high school to apply. Following nomination, students submit an online application with essays and recommendations.

opportunities.title: RISE at Boston University
opportunities.description: Internship and practicum tracks to choose from. Engage in research in one of 15 fields.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 6-week research program offering Internship and Practicum tracks at BU.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Boston University offers you the opportunity to engage in research in one of 15 fields under the guidance of a mentor. The program comes with tuition fees ($6,185 in 2025), but limited financial aid is available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research 40 hours per week (Internship track)
  • Participate in structured group research (Practicum track)
  • Attend weekly workshops on scientific communication

Requirements:

  • Rising seniors (current juniors)
  • Domestic and international students eligible
  • Strong academic recommendation

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship by BU faculty
  • College credit opportunities
  • Social activities and campus life experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring essays, high school transcript, and recommendations from a science teacher and counselor.

opportunities.title: Wistar’s High School Summer Program in Biomedical Research
opportunities.description: Solid introduction into biomedical careers. Immerses participants in the ins and outs of biomedical research.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 4-week biomedical research immersion in Philadelphia.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Taking place at the Wistar Institute, this program immerses its 15 motivated participants in the ins and outs of biomedical research. You don’t need any previous research experience to apply. A $1,500 stipend is available.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn laboratory techniques and safety
  • Assist with ongoing biomedical projects
  • Attend seminars and career development sessions

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+ by program start
  • Completed at least one high school science course
  • Availability for the full 4 weeks

What We Offer:

  • $1,500 stipend
  • Solid introduction to biomedical careers
  • Hands-on lab experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit an online application. No prior research experience is required, but a strong interest in science is necessary.

opportunities.title: Careers in Science (CiS)
opportunities.description: Year-round engagement with hands-on experience in science careers. Paid internship program.
opportunities.shortDescription: A multi-year paid internship at the California Academy of Sciences.
opportunities.fullDescription:
With this paid internship program, the California Academy of Sciences strives to make STEM careers more accessible to traditionally underrepresented communities. You’ll be paid above minimum wage for your participation.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in science education and fieldwork
  • Work on research projects with Academy scientists
  • Attend training sessions and leadership workshops

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • San Francisco residents preferred
  • Commitment to a multi-year program

What We Offer:

  • Paid above minimum wage
  • Long-term mentorship
  • Year-round engagement
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application typically due in April. Includes personal statement and optional letter of recommendation. Interviews follow for semi-finalists.

opportunities.title: NASA Internship Programs
opportunities.description: Diverse in-person/hybrid/virtual opportunities. Over 2,000 students take part every year.
opportunities.shortDescription: Various internships at NASA centers nationwide.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every year, over 2,000 students take part in NASA’s many internships and research programs. Opportunities vary by center and project, offering in-person, hybrid, and virtual options.

Responsibilities:

  • Support NASA projects in engineering, science, or operations
  • Collaborate with NASA mentors
  • Complete a final presentation or project

Requirements:

  • U.S. Citizenship
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA
  • At least 16 years of age

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to space exploration missions
  • Professional networking within NASA
  • Stipend (varies by academic level)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply through the official NASA STEM Gateway. One application can be used for multiple opportunities.

opportunities.title: Student Historian Internship Program
opportunities.description: Year-round program with a focus on history research. Test drive a career as a historian.
opportunities.shortDescription: A history-focused internship at the New York Historical Society.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Ever dreamed of becoming a historian? The New York Historical Society will help you test drive this career. Participants receive a $700 stipend. The museum selects 25 interns per cohort.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct historical research
  • Develop digital projects or tours
  • Engage with museum visitors

Requirements:

  • Entering grades 10-12
  • Must reside in the NYC metro area
  • Interest in history and museums

What We Offer:

  • $700 Stipend
  • Behind-the-scenes museum access
  • Public speaking and research skills
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit online application including short essays. Finalists are invited for group interviews.

opportunities.title: BRAINYAC
opportunities.description: Access to Columbia laboratories with cutting-edge equipment. Neuroscience-focused research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Neuroscience research experience for NYC youth at Columbia University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every summer, the Zuckerman Institute’s program invites high schoolers from partner programs to participate in neuroscience-focused research. The program is organized in collaboration with Columbia University.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn laboratory techniques
  • Work on a designated neuroscience project
  • Present findings at a poster session

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Must be enrolled in specific partner programs (S-PREP, Lang, etc.)
  • NYC residents only

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Access to cutting-edge Columbia labs
  • Mentorship from neuroscientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application available through partner programs. Contact the Zuckerman Institute for list of qualifying partner organizations.

opportunities.title: JAX Summer Student Program
opportunities.description: Focus on laboratory discovery and scientific communication. Intensive 10-week program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Genetics and genomics research program at The Jackson Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Interested in genome research? The Jackson Laboratory offers an intensive 10-week program focusing on genetic testing, data visualization, and peer review. A $7,000 stipend and housing are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute an independent research project
  • Analyze data and present findings
  • Participate in the residential life program

Requirements:

  • Graduating high school seniors
  • Must be at least 18 years old by move-in date
  • Demonstrated passion for science

What We Offer:

  • $7,000 Stipend
  • Room and board included
  • Focus on scientific communication
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires two letters of recommendation, transcripts, and a resume.

opportunities.title: Stanford Institutes of Medicine Summer Research Program (SIMR)
opportunities.description: Networking opportunity on the Stanford campus. Basics of medical research under mentorship.
opportunities.shortDescription: 8-week medical research program at Stanford University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
If medical research sparks your interest, the SIMR program will introduce you to its basics under the mentorship of Stanford researchers. Stipends are available; admissions favor Bay Area students.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct hands-on research in a specific institute (e.g., Cancer Biology, Immunology)
  • Attend safety training and lectures
  • Present a research poster at the end of the program

Requirements:

  • Juniors and seniors aged 16+
  • U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents
  • Preference for local Bay Area students

What We Offer:

  • Stipend (needs-based options available)
  • Direct mentorship from Stanford faculty
  • Exposure to careers in medicine
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application with essay questions. Requires transcript and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Anson L. Clark Scholar Program
opportunities.description: Open to students in both STEM and humanities. Free program with meals, room, and board included.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive research scholar program at Texas Tech University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every summer, 12 highly motivated high schoolers take part in this free program (meals, room, and board included). You can choose from eight research areas, from physics to history.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete a research project in chosen field
  • Attend weekly seminars and field trips
  • Submit a final research report

Requirements:

  • Students graduating in 2026 or 2027
  • Aged 17+ by program start date
  • Highly competitive academic record

What We Offer:

  • $750 tax-free stipend
  • Room and board provided
  • Broad range of research fields (STEM & Humanities)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online. Includes essays, academic transcripts, and up to three letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: High School Research Program (HSRP)
opportunities.description: Opportunity to participate in transformative science and technology research at Brookhaven National Lab.
opportunities.shortDescription: 6-week commuter research program at Brookhaven National Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
If you aspire to pursue STEM studies, the Brookhaven National Laboratory’s free commuter program is for you. The organization recommends applying if you’ve completed 11th grade.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with scientific staff on projects
  • Attend educational workshops
  • Commute daily to the laboratory (housing not provided)

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+
  • Completion of 11th grade recommended
  • U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident status usually required

What We Offer:

  • Access to national laboratory facilities
  • Transformative research experience
  • Networking with professional scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via the BNL Office of Educational Programs system. Requires transcript and recommendations.

opportunities.title: High School Summer Research Experience in Cancer (SURE-CAN)
opportunities.description: Solid introduction to the basics of cancer sciences. Intern in 'dry' or 'wet' lab research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Cancer research internship at Roswell Park for Western NY students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Roswell Park, a cancer center, welcomes students motivated to intern in ‘dry’ or ‘wet’ lab research. The SURE-CAN program is free, with limited need-based financial aid available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in cancer science
  • Participate in professional development seminars
  • Present a final poster

Requirements:

  • Enrolled in junior year (rising senior)
  • Aged 15+
  • Must be a resident of Western New York

What We Offer:

  • Insight into cancer research
  • Options for wet (lab) or dry (data) research
  • Need-based financial aid
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Students must rank their top areas of scientific interest.

opportunities.title: JCVI Internship Program
opportunities.description: Opportunity to earn while doing research. Paid internship at J. Craig Venter Institute.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid genomics and bioinformatics internship at JCVI.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Yes, it’s not just a biomedical research opportunity; it’s a paid internship that will earn you $17.50/hour. Most internship options take place in the summer, but some year-round opportunities are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform assigned research tasks in genomics or bioinformatics
  • Attend intern development activities
  • Collaborate with mentors on scientific projects

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+
  • Eligible to work in the U.S.
  • Strong interest in biological sciences

What We Offer:

  • Paid position ($17.50/hour)
  • Real-world lab experience
  • Locations in CA and MD
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via the JCVI careers page. Requires a resume and cover letter tailored to the specific internship opening.

opportunities.title: Memorial Sloan Kettering Summer Student Program
opportunities.description: Focus on self-directed projects. Biomedical and computational lab-based internship.
opportunities.shortDescription: 8-week cancer research internship at MSK for local students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Another cancer center on our list, Memorial Sloan Kettering, organizes a biomedical and computational lab-based internship for high schoolers every summer. Participants receive a $1,200 stipend.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on independent research projects
  • Attend extracurricular events and tours
  • Prepare a final presentation

Requirements:

  • Enrolled in junior year
  • Aged 14+
  • Residing within 25 miles of the campus (Commuter only)

What We Offer:

  • $1,200 stipend
  • World-class cancer research environment
  • Mentorship from MSK faculty
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including short essays, transcript, and two letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Broad Summer Scholars Program
opportunities.description: Interesting social events and ample learning opportunities. No previous research experience required.
opportunities.shortDescription: 6-week genomics research program at Broad Institute.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Broad Institute’s free summer program is for high schoolers interested in science. Excitement is a must; research experience is not. A $3,600 stipend and partial travel cost reimbursement are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct original research in a lab
  • Attend career panels and scientific talks
  • Present research at a final poster session

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors and seniors
  • Interest in genomics and biomedicine
  • Available for the full 6 weeks

What We Offer:

  • $3,600 stipend
  • No prior experience required
  • Partial travel reimbursement
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring short essay responses and contact information for a reference.

opportunities.title: Next Generation STEM Internship Program (NGSI)
opportunities.description: Multiple opportunities for professional development. Focuses on energy and environmental research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid internship at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Oak Ridge National Laboratory offers multiple paid internship sessions: you can apply for summer, fall, and spring cohorts. The laboratory itself focuses on energy and environmental research.

Responsibilities:

  • Support research projects in energy and environment
  • Participate in professional development workshops
  • Network with laboratory staff

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors/seniors or recent graduates
  • Aged 16+
  • U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residency typically required

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Access to a DOE National Laboratory
  • Professional development opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the Zintellect system (ORISE). Requires a resume and academic records.

opportunities.title: ACS Project SEED
opportunities.description: Opportunities available across the country. Pursue research across 40 U.S. states.
opportunities.shortDescription: Summer research program for economically disadvantaged students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every year, more than 350 students interested in chemistry get the opportunity to pursue research across 40 U.S. states and territories. Participation in the SEED program also makes you eligible for its college scholarships.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct chemistry-related research for 8-10 weeks
  • Work under the supervision of a scientist mentor
  • Participate in safety training

Requirements:

  • High school students with interest in chemistry
  • Economically disadvantaged family background (financial criteria apply)
  • U.S. based

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • College scholarship eligibility
  • Mentorship in chemistry careers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Students apply online. The application requires financial documentation to prove eligibility and academic transcripts.
